intro: Sphaerocephalus niveus, commonly known as the white-headed daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its spherical, white flower heads surrounded by pale green bracts. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its small, daisy-like flowers bloom in spring and summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Sphaerocephalus niveus is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
